Driver.Description: Autoload and configuration management for GigaVUE-OS devices
Driver.Name: GigamonDriver

Command.Name: shutdown
Command.Description: Sends a graceful shutdown to the device

Parameter.Name: custom_command
Parameter.Description: The command to run. Note that commands that require a response are not supported.

Parameter.Name: mode
Parameter.Description: Snapshot save mode, can be one of two values 'shallow' (default) or 'deep'

Parameter.Name: custom_params
Parameter.Description: Set of custom parameters for the save operation

Parameter.Name: saved_details
Parameter.Description: A JSON string representing the state to restore including saved artifacts and info

Command.Name: health_check
Command.Description: Checks if the device is up and connectable

Command.Name: run_custom_command
Command.Description: Executes a custom command on the device

Parameter.Name: custom_command
Parameter.Description: The command to run. Note that commands that require a response are not supported.

Command.Name: save
Command.Description: Creates a configuration file and saves it to the provided destination

Parameter.Name: configuration_type
Parameter.Description: Specify whether the file should update the startup or running config. 'Startup' configuration is not supported on all switches.

Parameter.Name: folder_path
Parameter.Description: The path in which the configuration file will be saved. For a local file, specify the filename. For a network location, specify only the *folder* -- the filename will be generated automatically. The path should include the protocol type (for example tftp://123.45.67.89/folder/path). The full path to the generated config file will be shown in the output window.

Parameter.Name: vrf_management_name
Parameter.Description: Optional. Virtual routing and Forwarding management name

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Description: The path to the configuration file, including the configuration file name. The path should include the protocol type (for example tftp://asdf).

Parameter.Name: configuration_type
Parameter.Description: Specify whether the file should update the startup or running config. 'Startup' configuration is not supported on all switches.

Parameter.Name: restore_method
Parameter.Description: Determines whether the restore should append or override the current configuration.

Parameter.Name: vrf_management_name
Parameter.Description: Optional. Virtual routing and Forwarding management name

Command.Name: load_firmware
Command.Description: Upload and updates firmware on the resource

Parameter.Name: remote_host
Parameter.Description: Path to tftp server where firmware file is stored. Use 'none' for a local file.

Parameter.Name: file_path
Parameter.Description: Firmware local file name or URL (including tftp://, ftp://, http://, etc.)

Command.Name: add_chassis_to_cluster_master
Command.Description: Adds chassis and serials to cluster DB for all nodes

Command.Name: create_cluster
Command.Description: Enables cluster on this device with given parameters

Parameter.Name: interface
Parameter.Description: Interface to configure as the Stack_Mgmt Interface

Parameter.Name: cluster_id
Parameter.Description: Cluster ID to set

Parameter.Name: cluster_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the cluster

Parameter.Name: master_preference
Parameter.Description: Cluster priority value

Parameter.Name: master_vip
Parameter.Description: Address for the master VIP

Command.Name: apply_text_config
Command.Description: Applies the selected config from tftp

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Description: Full path on ftp to the config file

Parameter.Name: file_name
Parameter.Description: Name of config file [.txt]

Command.Name: reset
Command.Description: Resets the device to factory settings
